super_definition:
Code posts as Green if they refer in a neutral or positive light to:

Environmental topics such as climate change, environment, nature, or sustainability
recycling and waste management (as defined below)
greenhouse gas emissions reductions (as defined below)
low-carbon technologies (as defined below)
false solutions (as defined below).

sub_categories.definition: The company claims to be working (or to have worked or pledges to work) to decrease the greenhouse gas emissions (or ‚Äúcarbon footprint‚Äù) associated with its operations and/or products, either in absolute or relative terms (such as ‚Äúcarbon intensity‚Äù) and often in reference to a purported ambition by the company to reach net-zero emissions. These claims can be with or without reference to specific technology.
sub_categories.label: emissions_reduction

super_definition:
Code posts as Green if they refer in a neutral or positive light to:

Environmental topics such as climate change, environment, nature, or sustainability
recycling and waste management (as defined below)
greenhouse gas emissions reductions (as defined below)
low-carbon technologies (as defined below)
false solutions (as defined below).

sub_categories.definition:
The company claims to be investing in (or to have invested in or to have plans to invest in) or to be otherwise working (or to have worked or to have plans to work) to develop and/or deploy low-carbon technologies. The claims present the company as a critical player in the transition to low-carbon technologies. Posts should only be categorized if they discuss renewables in a neutral or positive light; negative sentiments towards renewables do not count.

We define low-carbon technologies to include:

‚Äúrenewable energy‚Äù (also ‚Äúlow-carbon electricity‚Äù, ‚Äúclean energy‚Äù, ‚Äúgreen energy‚Äù, and other general references to low-carbon technologies that do not mention specific technologies)
solar energy
wind energy
marine energy
Hydropower
geothermal energy
nuclear energy
battery electric vehicles (and associated charging infrastructure)
plug-in hybrid vehicles
renewable energy storage
renewable energy transmission

We define low-carbon technologies to exclude all ‚Äòfalse‚Äô solutions (as also defined below) as well as all fossil fuels (not just those portrayed as environmentally beneficial):

carbon capture and storage (CCS)
carbon capture, utilization, and storage (CCUS)
bioenergy (including biofuels for transportation, sometimes referred to as ‚Äúrenewable fuels‚Äù or ‚Äúsustainable fuels‚Äù, and biomass for heat and electricity generation)
hydrogen energy (for transportation or electricity generation)
all fossil fuels
emissions offset/credit schemes
energy efficiency
fuel cell vehicles
sustainable aviation fuels (SAFs)
fuel-based solutions that depend on clean energy (for example, hydrogen made from renewables)
sub_categories.examples:

sub_categories.label: renewable_energy

super_definition:
Code posts as Green if they refer in a neutral or positive light to:

Environmental topics such as climate change, environment, nature, or sustainability
recycling and waste management (as defined below)
greenhouse gas emissions reductions (as defined below)
low-carbon technologies (as defined below)
false solutions (as defined below).

sub_categories.definition:
The company claims to be investing in (or to have invested in or to have plans to invest in) or to be otherwise working (or to have worked or to have plans to work) to develop and/or deploy ‚Äòfalse‚Äô solutions. Only categorize posts if they position the technologies listed below as:

solutions to mitigating climate change (including implying that any of the technologies below are reducing emissions, are low-carbon, or are sustainable)
reducing emissions
otherwise achieving a low-carbon reality or future

We define false solutions to include:

carbon capture and storage (CCS)
carbon capture, utilization, and storage (CCUS)
bioenergy (including biofuels for transportation, sometimes referred to as ‚Äúrenewable fuels‚Äù or ‚Äúsustainable fuels‚Äù, and biomass for heat and electricity generation)
hydrogen energy (for transportation or electricity generation)
fossil fuels portrayed as environmentally beneficial (including ‚Äúclean coal‚Äù, ‚Äúclean‚Äù or ‚Äúcleaner‚Äù natural gas, and ‚Äúsustainable‚Äù gasoline)
emissions offset/credit schemes
energy efficiency
fuel cell vehicles
sustainable aviation fuels (SAFs)
fuel-based solutions that depend on clean energy (for example, hydrogen made from renewables)

We define false solutions to exclude all low-carbon technologies (as also defined above):

‚Äúrenewable energy‚Äù (also ‚Äúlow-carbon electricity‚Äù, ‚Äúclean energy‚Äù, ‚Äúgreen energy‚Äù, and other general references to low-carbon technologies that do not mention specific technologies)
solar energy
wind energy
marine energy
Hydropower
geothermal energy
nuclear energy
battery electric vehicles (and associated charging infrastructure)
plug-in hybrid vehicles
renewable energy storage
renewable energy transmission
sub_categories.examples:

sub_categories.label: false_solutions

super_definition:
Code posts as Green if they refer in a neutral or positive light to:

Environmental topics such as climate change, environment, nature, or sustainability
recycling and waste management (as defined below)
greenhouse gas emissions reductions (as defined below)
low-carbon technologies (as defined below)
false solutions (as defined below).

sub_categories.definition:
The company claims to support, be investing in (or to have invested in or to have plans to invest in), or to be otherwise working (or to have worked or to have plans to work) to develop and/or deploy recycling or waste management solutions. 

We define recycling or waste management solutions to include:

Recycling
waste management
reduced waste and landfills
Reduced usage/more reuse
circular economies
reusable or sustainable plastics, polymers, and packaging
sub_categories.examples:
Tyler Baran and Tom Miller will present an overview of several mechanically recyclable, flexible packaging solutions for primary and secondary packaging. This is a short webinar providing a high-level overview of resin and package performance. https://t.co/DTw6OOjb7t https://t.co/poooCRDykt [148294587]
Multi-material structures are difficult, if not impossible, to recycle with widely available mechanical processes. ExxonMobil has ‚Ä¶[61940509]
sub_categories.label: recycling

super_definition:
Code posts as Green if they refer in a neutral or positive light to:

Environmental topics such as climate change, environment, nature, or sustainability
recycling and waste management (as defined below)
greenhouse gas emissions reductions (as defined below)
low-carbon technologies (as defined below)
false solutions (as defined below).

sub_categories.definition: Any post labelled as Green but not fitting into any of the Green sub-category labels
sub_categories.label: other_green

super_definition:
Code posts as Fossil Fuel if refer to:

Fossil fuel primary products (as defined below)
Petrochemicals or Petrochemical Products (as defined below)
Fossil fuel infrastructure and production (as defined below)

sub_categories.definition:
The company mentions fossil fuels or fossil fuel-based motor fuels, subject to the following conditions:

Include any explicitly named fossil fuel primary product regardless of environmental sentiment (i.e. regardless of whether fossil fuel primary products are portrayed as environmentally beneficial, harmful, or neutral). Thus, include ‚Äúrenewable diesel‚Äù, ‚Äúclean natural gas‚Äù, ‚Äúclean coal‚Äù, etc.
References by fossil fuel companies to ‚Äúfuels‚Äù should be assumed by default to be fossil fuel-based and thus labeled as Fossil fuel primary products. Thus, include ‚Äúmarine fuel‚Äù, ‚Äúaviation fuel‚Äù, ‚Äúsustainable fuel‚Äù, ‚Äúrenewable fuel‚Äù, ‚Äúlower emission fuel‚Äù, etc. This also includes fossil fuel-based motor fuel product lines such as Synergy and Mobil 1. 
Include references to companies as fossil fuel companies, oil and gas companies, etc.
Do not include fossil fuel primary products that are implied but not named. For example, do not include carbon capture and storage or carbon offsetting unless their associated fossil fuel primary products are explicitly mentioned.
Aside from the fossil fuel-based motor fuels gasoline and diesel, do not include Petrochemicals or Petrochemical Products because they are not primary fossil fuel products.

Note that Fossil fuel primary products and Fossil fuel infrastructure and production will often overlap, particularly when fossil fuels are mentioned in the context of infrastructure or production. These two categories are not mutually exclusive and should both be coded as needed. For example, ‚Äúoil production‚Äù should be coded as both Fossil fuel primary products and Fossil fuel infrastructure and production.

But there is a distinction. If oil/gas/coal etc. is mentioned only in the context of the production or infrastructure of it, do not label it as 1 (primary product), unless mentioned elsewhere in the text standalone OR if the focus of the production statement is explicitly on the outcome of the production/infrastructure. Distinguish between process/doing/creating and the outcome.

We define fossil fuel primary products to include:

fossil fuels 
Coal
Oil
natural gas (aka methane, liquified natural gas (LNG))
fossil fuel-based motor fuels 
Gasoline
Diesel

We define fossil fuel primary products to exclude:

Biofuels
algae oils
oil seed
hydrogen fuel
sub_categories.examples:
What does premium fuel do? In the final episode our Esso scientists set out to answer this question‚Ä¶ and some of the other ‚Ä¶ [61941163]
ExxonMobil's Tze San Koh explains how natural gas is supporting a brighter future. [10949598]
Do you know a young woman, 35 or younger, who is excelling early in her #LNG career? Nominate her for our #PowerPlayAwards‚Äô Rising Star Award: https://t.co/UOtOpIdevJ. #WomenInLNG https://t.co/Qf4hCNFRti [56874146]
Today we announced our plans to join the Oil and Gas Climate Initiative, a voluntary initiative representing 13 of the world‚Äôs largest oil and gas producers working collaboratively toward solutions to mitigate the risks of #climatechange. @OGCINews https://t.co/n2ArwkJV9o https://t.co/cASGDUMHGf [11018213]
sub_categories.label: primary_product

super_definition:
Code posts as Fossil Fuel if refer to:

Fossil fuel primary products (as defined below)
Petrochemicals or Petrochemical Products (as defined below)
Fossil fuel infrastructure and production (as defined below)

sub_categories.definition:
The company mentions petrochemicals or products derived from petrochemicals, excluding fossil fuel-based motor fuels (gasoline and diesel).

We define Petrochemicals or Petrochemical Products to include:

Petrochemicals
Olefins
Aromatic compounds
Petrochemical Products
Plastics
Packaging
Polymers
synthetic resins
Lubricants
Detergents
motor oils
Any other products explicitly described as derived from hydrocarbons

We define Petrochemicals or Petrochemical Products to exclude:

fossil fuels 
Coal
Oil
natural gas (aka methane, liquified natural gas (LNG))
fossil fuel-based motor fuels 
Gasoline
Diesel
sub_categories.examples:
Large appliance parts with an excellent impact/stiffness balance using ExxonMobil ICP PP resin.[61940643]
The first foamable polypropylene that enables you to unlock opportunities in high-volume applications that benefit from low ‚Ä¶[61940682]
#DYK that thousands of medical devices people use every day are made using oil and natural gas? https://t.co/at6iFopgkO [11018613]
sub_categories.label: petrochemical_product

super_definition:
Code posts as Fossil Fuel if refer to:

Fossil fuel primary products (as defined below)
Petrochemicals or Petrochemical Products (as defined below)
Fossil fuel infrastructure and production (as defined below)

sub_categories.definition:
INFRASTRUCTURE
The company explicitly refers to the production of fossil fuels, petrochemicals, or petrochemical products, and/or to the infrastructure associated with it.

We define Fossil fuel infrastructure as infrastructure owned or operated by fossil fuel companies that is associated with the exploration and production of fossil fuels, petrochemicals, or petrochemical products. Examples include:

oil and gas drilling facilities
Coal mines
Refineries
Pipelines
oil barrels/cylinders
chemical plants
oil fields
oil well
LNG plants
petrochemical plants

The definition of Fossil fuel infrastructure is subject to the following conditions:

Only infrastructure that is explicitly described as relating to fossil fuels should be labeled. For example, a ‚Äúplant‚Äù, ‚Äúpower plant‚Äù, ‚Äúbarrel‚Äù, ‚Äúfacility‚Äù, ‚Äúcomplex‚Äù, ‚Äúsite‚Äù, ‚Äúoperation‚Äù etc. should not be labeled, but a ‚Äúnatural gas plant‚Äù or a ‚Äúbarrel of oil‚Äù or ‚Äúdrilling site‚Äù should be.
Do not label infrastructure that is identified simply by its name or geographical location. For example, ‚ÄúPermian Basin‚Äù or ‚Äúour Texas facility‚Äù should not be labeled, but ‚Äúnatural gas plant in the Permian Basin‚Äù or ‚ÄúTexas LNG facility‚Äù should be.
Do not include infrastructure explicitly presented as entirely associated with renewable energy or false solutions, as defined above. For example, do not include barrels of biofuels.
Include infrastructure that is only in the process of being decarbonized or transitioning to renewables.

"PRODUCTION
We define Fossil fuel production as activities related to the investment in or execution of: exploration for, extraction of, or processing of fossil fuels (coal, oil, and natural gas). Examples include fossil fuel:

Drilling
Refining
Conditioning
Producing
Transportation

The definition of Fossil fuel production is subject to the following conditions:

Only activities that are explicitly described as relating to fossil fuels should be labeled. For example, ‚Äúproduction in Guyana‚Äù, ‚Äúrefining‚Äù, ‚Äúoperations‚Äù, ‚Äúactivities‚Äù, ‚Äúprojects‚Äù, ‚Äúenergy production‚Äù etc. should not be labeled, but ‚Äúgas production in Guyana‚Äù and ‚Äúoil refining‚Äù should. 
Do not label activities that are explicitly described as renewable energy or false solution projects, as defined above. 
Include references to companies as "fossil fuel producers", "oil and gas producers", etc.
sub_categories.examples:

super_definition:
Code posts as Fossil Fuel if refer to:

Fossil fuel primary products (as defined below)
Petrochemicals or Petrochemical Products (as defined below)
Fossil fuel infrastructure and production (as defined below)

super_definition: If no relevant label identified, then code as Null
